content:
I've made some changes to the clash. The following are the main ones:

Goal
* Changed "2 pairs of hex colors" to "2 hex colors".

* Reformatted "0x" as a constant.

* Changed "hex numbers" to "hex digits".

Input
* Rewrote the description and removed the example.

Output
* Removed the example.

Constraints
* Removed the constraint (which only consisted of two words: "Inputs are").
fixed the stub generator - strings are length 8, not 6

I don't like it in reverse.

There are no tests for the cases when the average red, green, or blue is 1-digit.
Just in general, create more test cases. You essentially have 3.5 tests. Something like 5.5-6.5 would be ideal. 


Otherwise, pretty good.

I really like
> Constraints
> Inputs are

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: So much fun.

My JS solution:
r=_=>readline().slice(2).match(/../g).map(x=>parseInt(x,16))
print("0x"+r(A=r()).map((x,i)=>((x+A[i])/2).toString(16)).join``.toUpperCase())

Nice problem for CoC, easy to understand and good difficulty. 
Just a very small comment: I'd change the wording of "2 hex numbers" in "2 hex numbers represents RED" to "2 hex digits" or "2 hex characters". It's obvious for people who know color encoding in hex, but otherwise some people might confuse it with the 2 hex numbers you get as input.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good problem, testing both string manipulation and integer base conversion.

For reverse mode, might be better to append an 0x at the start of the string to indicate it is hexadecimal.
[WIP] Description definitely needs some improvements. Test-cases are most probably complete (not sure if I can achieve some corner cases)

you can and you should... if you can !
just did it in code golf and a guy submited a really low score. I was just... how ?!!?
So i end up to add the two value (whole) and that enough for test and validator.
Looks great but this is false with for example :
0x000180
0x000080
where the false solution give 0x000100 and the right answer is 0x000080.
Also i was confused about the rounding mode of average because no mention of it. After trying i notice that is was down but with the same example 0x000180 could be right answer.

nice idea -> added.
thanks for approval
Cool. Ping me when you're done
Clash updated with new test-cases and updated solution
